info.title: ignore-me README
info.subtitle: Generator for ignoring files for Autotools based projects

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This program helps by creating a new ignore file in your project. Currently it supports BZR, CVS, GIT, HG and SVN.
ignore-me is released under the GNU General Public License (GPL) version 3+, see the file 'COPYING' for more information.

note.para: The official web site is: https://launchpad.net/ignore-me. Github is used just as a mirror.

sect2.title: Ideas
sect2.para: If have some good ideas for stuff that you want to see in this program you should check the TODO file first before sending email.

sect2.title: Cool Hacks
sect2.para: If you want to provide a cool hack, so please follow that proposals:

listitem.para: Open a bug report on https://bugs.launchpad.net/ignore-me.
Please use the -u flag when generating the patch as it makes the patch more readable.
Write a good explanation of what the patch does.
It is better to use git format-patch command: git format-patch HEAD^

sect2.title: Merging
sect2.para: If you want to merge your branch with the trunk, click on "Propose for merging" on Launchpad. Please base all Merge requests off the trunk branch. Merges to X.X only occur through the trunk branch.

sect2.title: Maintanance Policy
sect2.para: I'm following the Semantic Versioning for its releases: (Major).(Minor).(Patch).

listitem.para: Major version: Whenever there is something significant or any backwards incompatible changes.
Minor version: When new, backwards compatible functionality is introduced a minor feature is introduced, or when a set of smaller features is rolled out.
Patch number: When backwards compatible bug fixes are introduced that fix incorrect behavior.
The current stable release will receive security patches and bug fixes (eg. 5.0 -> 5.0.1).
Feature releases will mark the next supported stable release where the minor version is increased numerically by increments of one (eg. 5.0 -> 5.1).

sect2.para: I encourage everyone to run the latest stable release to ensure that you can easily upgrade to the most secure and feature rich experience. In order to make sure you can easily run the most recent stable release, we are working hard to keep the update process simple and reliable.

sect2.title: Prequisites
sect2.para:
For building and running ignore-me you need:
xsltproc (for the manpage)
python3
itstool

sect2.title: Installation
sect2.para: The Installation process is described on: https://saigkill.github.io/ignore-me/userdocs/ignore-me/index.html#sec.installation.

sect2.title: Bug Reporting
sect2.para: Bugs should be reported to https://bugs.launchpad.net/ignore-me. You will need to create an account for yourself. See if is your problem is already reported.
